short-title.#text:
Preserving Access to Targeted,
			 Individualized, and Effective New Treatments and Services (PATIENTS) Act of
			 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 Certain Uses of Data Obtained from Comparative Effectiveness Research;
			 Accounting for Personalized Medicine and Differences in Patient Treatment
			 Response

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any
			 other provision of law, the

shall not use data obtained from the
			 conduct of comparative effectiveness research, including such research that is
			 conducted or supported using funds appropriated under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or authorized or appropriated under
			 the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
American Recovery and
			 Reinvestment Act of 2009
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: American Recovery and Reinvestment Act of 2009

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, to deny or
			 delay coverage of an item or service under a Federal health care program (as
			 defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1128B(f) of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
shall ensure that
			 comparative effectiveness research conducted or supported by the Federal
			 Government accounts for factors contributing to differences in the treatment
			 response and treatment preferences of patients, including patient-reported
			 outcomes, genomics and personalized medicine, the unique needs of health
			 disparity populations, and indirect patient benefits.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Federal
			 Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

text.#text:
Nothing in this section shall be construed as
			 affecting the authority of the

current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To protect all patients by prohibiting the use of data
		  obtained from comparative effectiveness research to deny or delay coverage of
		  items or services under Federal health care programs and to ensure that
		  comparative effectiveness research accounts for advancements in personalized
		  medicine and differences in patient treatment response.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Health, Education, Labor,
			 and Pensions
